section: Exercise 4.9.3: Choosing a lineup for a traveling basketball team.
instructions: There are 20 members of a basketball team.
question:
(b)

From the 12 players who will travel, the coach must select her starting line-up. She will select a player for each of the five positions: center, right forward, left forward, right guard, left guard. How many ways are there for her to select the starting line-up?
answer: Suppose that the starters are placed into positions in the order in which they are selected. That is, the first player selected will play center, the second will play right forward, etc. The order in which the players are selected is important because the order determines which player plays which position. The number of ways to select an ordered list of five players from a set of 12 with no repetitions is P(12, 5).
